column4: I just booted from a 10.04 desktop cd, it gets to a purple background and displays an error window: "Installation failed, The installer encountered an unrecoverable error. A desktop session will now be run so that you may investigate the problem or try installing again."
At what point does it fail? During partitioning or copying system files?
it was just the live cd running.
so you never made it to the gui installer?
no. But it has 10.04 installed on it already.
You can chroot into the system to try and get a cli for it
could you please step me through that.
Ok, can you say what device node your disk is? Like /dev/sda1 or sda2
I mean for the partition where you have the broken 10.04 upgrade. Is it sda1 or something else?
I mounted it from the gui. It's mounted /media/ee279660-d645 etc
ah ok
is there a 'repair installation' gui wizard?
Can you say what device name it is though? See the output of 'mount'
sdb3
ok
Open a file with 'gedit chroot && chmod +x chroot' and paste the contents into the file then save it and close http://pastebin.org/289303
so what should I do next? Is there a 'repair installation' available from the live disc or is it more involved than that?
ok one sec, thank you.
make sure not to get the line numbers (select from the bottom half of the page)
ok done.
Now run it with 'sudo ./chroot' and it should give you a prompt to your broken system
sorry didn't put 'soreau' in that last msg. Did you see the error message I got?
are you still there?
